channel.title: BBC News - Scotland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Scottish Greens back historic government deal
item.description: Party members voted overwhelmingly to support an agreement that will see their co-leaders becoming ministers.

item.title: The deal is done - so what lies ahead?
item.description: BBC Scotland's political editor Glenn Campbell on the historic agreement that will take the Greens into government

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Warning as major events return despite Covid surge
item.description: Health experts are urging spectators and organisers to be extra vigilant after daily cases hit a record high.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Fire crews tackle blaze at Nick Nairn restaurant
item.description: More than 30 firefighters are called to a fire in the kitchen of Nick's in Bridge of Allan, near Stirling.

item.title: How Scotland's City of Culture bids stack up
item.description: The case being made for three very different parts of the country to secure the status for 2025.

item.title: Man 'critical' after being shot in Glasgow murder bid
item.description: Police say the 44-year-old received life-threatening injuries in a targeted attack in the Milton area of Glasgow.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Neil and Lora Fachie both win Paralympic gold for GB
item.description: Husband and wife Neil and Lora Fachie both win Paralympic gold for Britain on the last day of track cycling events in Tokyo.

item.title: Scotland's most remote school seeks new headteacher
item.description: The current head of the school on Fair Isle, which has just three pupils, is stepping down after 35 years.

item.title: Vigil: Submarine drama explores 'isolating and tense' life and death at sea
item.description: Suranne Jones and Martin Compston star in BBC One's Vigil, set on board a nuclear submarine.

item.title: Kyogo Furuhashi: Two men arrested over alleged hate crime against Celtic star
item.description: Police said the men, aged 26 and 30, are due to appear before Hamilton Sheriff Court at a later date.

item.title: COP26: Queen to attend climate conference in Glasgow
item.description: The monarch will join leaders including Pope Francis and US President Joe Biden at the UN event in November.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Is the drive to get young people jabbed working?
item.description: Covid cases are rising sharply in young adults despite all over 16s being eligible for vaccination.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Almost 40% of 16 and 17-year-olds receive vaccine
item.description: The Scottish government hopes to have offered everyone in the age group a first dose by late September.

item.title: Covid jab response low for some immunosuppressed people
item.description: Some high risk patients had few or no infection-fighting antibodies in their blood, a vaccine study found.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid: Is Scotland lagging behind on vaccine certificates?
item.description: A digital "passport" has been rolled out across the EU - so why does Scotland use a paper system?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: 'Now other women won't be haunted by the labour ward'
item.description: A woman who delivered her stillborn baby in a room next to expectant mothers helps make sure others do not have to.

item.title: Man drives horses 650 miles in police officer brother's memory
item.description: He is raising money for charities that helped his late brother when he was in a coma for 14 years.

item.title: Mortimer and Whitehouse: 'North Uist is the best show we've done'
item.description: The comedians visit the Western Isles for the new series of Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Meet the McCowan family going for Boccia gold
item.description: Jamie, Scott, Linda and Gary McCowan tell BBC Scotland about their Paralympic hopes, lockdown competitions, and Roy Keane mentality.

item.title: John McAleese: The SAS soldier who was the man behind the mask
item.description: John McAleese was the Scots soldier watched by millions on live television in the Iranian Embassy raid.

item.title: Golden eagle numbers surge in southern Scotland
item.description: A repopulation project successfully relocates eight more chicks to the area from the Highlands.

item.title: Tokyo 2020 Paralympics: Who are the 33 Scots in Paralympics GB?
item.description: BBC Sport profiles the 33 Scots in Paralympics GB as the Tokyo 2020 event gets under way.

item.title: Club completes challenge to bag all 282 Munros in a single day
item.description: Members of Carnethy Hill Running Club reached the summits of all 282 mountains in a single day.

item.title: How will SNP-Greens deal affect plans for the A96?
item.description: The SNP and Scottish Greens have agreed a power-sharing arrangement, but with "distinct positions" on the A96's future.

item.title: Billy Connolly: Challenges of Parkinson's getting worse
item.description: The 78-year-old has retired from live performances and says that making TV programmes is getting more challenging.

item.title: The tiny island school that needs a new teacher
item.description: A small school on a remote Scottish island is in the market for a new teacher.

item.title: Footage shows fire damage to Edinburgh 'Harry Potter' cafe
item.description: An early morning blaze caused fire, smoke and water damage to a cafe made famous by Harry Potter author JK Rowling.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Aileen McGlynn and Helen Scott win silver in 1000m time trial
item.description: Watch Aileen McGlynn and pilot Helen Scott win silver for ParalympicsGB in the women's B 1000m time trial at the Izu Velodrome on day two of the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games.

item.title: Billy Connolly: Challenges of Parkinson's getting worse
item.description: The 78-year old has retired from live performances and says that making TV programmes is getting more difficult.

item.title: SNP and Greens seal power-sharing deal
item.description: The SNP and the Scottish Greens set out their power-sharing deal for Holyrood.

item.title: Rangers v Celtic: What are the key battlegrounds in '50/50' Old Firm derby?
item.description: With Rangers and Celtic set to go head to head in the first Old Firm derby of the season, BBC Scotland looks at the key issues that may decide the clash.

item.title: Hibernian 2-0 Livingston: Bruce Anderson in hospital after fit on pitch as two team-mates are sick
item.description: Livingston striker Bruce Anderson has a diabetic fit and two other players vomit in the dressing room during their 2-0 loss to Hibernian.

item.title: Hibernian 2-0 Livingston: Martin Boyle & Kevin Nisbet edge hosts to victory
item.description: Hibernian's Martin Boyle is in a "brilliant place", says head coach Jack Ross, after he scored in a 2-0 Scottish Premiership victory over Livingston.

item.title: Dundee United 0-2 Hearts: Tynecastle side keep pace at top as Neilson wins on return
item.description: Promoted Hearts kept pace with Hibernian at the Scottish Premiership summit after a "world-class save" by Craig Gordon denied Dundee United, said manager Robbie Neilson.

item.title: Motherwell 1-0 Dundee: Tony Watt header secures 10-man hosts win
item.description: Motherwell's "brilliant" Scottish Premiership win over Dundee was earned despite a "harsh" late red card for Jake Carroll, said Graham Alexander.
